The 'word' parameter determines the search term. The snippet prints matching entries as results. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/index.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults find ${word} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Documentation Page Template DESCRIPTION: Full example template showing proper documentation structure including frontmatter, sections, command examples and UI instructions. Access Dock settings from macOS UI 2. Slide "Size" range value ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Set Finder to Show Hidden Files (macOS) DESCRIPTION: This command sets the `AppleShowAllFiles` preference to `true`, making hidden files visible in Finder. Requires killing the Finder process to immediately apply changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/finder/appleshowallextensions.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write NSGlobalDomain "AppleShowAllExtensions" -bool "true" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Set Finder Preference to Empty Bin After 30 Days (true) DESCRIPTION: This command sets the Finder preference `FXRemoveOldTrashItems` to `true`, enabling the automatic emptying of the bin after 30 days. It then restarts Finder to apply the changes. The `defaults` command is used to modify macOS preferences. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/finder/fxremoveoldtrashitems.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.finder "FXRemoveOldTrashItems" -bool "true" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing FolderTableOfContents Component in Vue DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the import of the FolderTableOfContents Vue component, which is essential for rendering a structured table of contents in the Simulator documentation. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/simulator/index.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Screenshot Location to Desktop in macOS Bash DESCRIPTION: This command sets the default screenshot location to the Desktop. It modifies the `location` property of the `com.apple.screencapture` domain and restarts the SystemUIServer to apply changes. Parameter type is a string specifying the path. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/screenshots/location.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.screencapture "location" -string "~/Desktop" && killall SystemUIServer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling macOS Keyboard Navigation DESCRIPTION: Enables keyboard navigation mode allowing Tab and Shift-Tab to move focus between all controls. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/keyboard/applekeyboarduimode.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write NSGlobalDomain AppleKeyboardUIMode -int "2" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Dock Icon Size to 36 Pixels DESCRIPTION: Bash command to configure Dock icon size to 36 pixels using defaults write and restart Dock process SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/dock/tilesize.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.dock "tilesize" -int "36" && killall Dock ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Screenshot Shadow DESCRIPTION: Command to remove the shadow effect from application screenshots. This creates cleaner screenshots without the default shadow effect. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/screenshots/disable-shadow.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.screencapture "disable-shadow" -bool "true" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Finder Folders on Top | Bash DESCRIPTION: Sets Finder's sorting option to keep folders on top when sorting by name in macOS. Requires macOS and appropriate permissions to execute commands. Input is directly executed in terminal, with snippets affecting Finder's folder display. Commands are applied immediately. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/finder/_fxsortfoldersfirst.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.finder "_FXSortFoldersFirst" -bool "true" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding MVVM Counterpart Suffixes in Xcode DESCRIPTION: Add 'ViewModel' and 'View' suffixes to Xcode's counterpart menu, useful for Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM) architectural patterns. Requires Xcode restart to take effect. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/xcode/ideadditionalcounterpartsuffixes.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.dt.Xcode "IDEAdditionalCounterpartSuffixes" -array-add "ViewModel" "View" && killall Xcode ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Current Folder Search Scope in macOS Finder DESCRIPTION: Sets the Finder default search scope to search the current folder using the SCcf parameter. Requires killing Finder process to apply changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/finder/fxdefaultsearchscope.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.finder "FXDefaultSearchScope" -string "SCcf" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Set Finder to Hide Hidden Files (macOS) DESCRIPTION: This command sets the `AppleShowAllFiles` preference to `false`, effectively hiding hidden files in Finder. It uses the `defaults` command to write the boolean value to the Finder's preferences and then restarts Finder to apply the changes. This is the default behavior of macOS. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/finder/appleshowallfiles.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.finder "AppleShowAllFiles" -bool "false" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Active Apps Only Mode in macOS Dock DESCRIPTION: Command to configure the Dock to display only currently running applications. This will clear existing pinned applications from the Dock. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/dock/static-only.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.dock "static-only" -bool "true" && killall Dock ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reading Current Dock Icon Size DESCRIPTION: Bash command to retrieve the current configured Dock icon size using defaults read SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/dock/tilesize.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults read com.apple.dock "tilesize" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Hide Removable Media on MacOS Desktop DESCRIPTION: Sets the ShowRemovableMediaOnDesktop flag to false in Finder preferences and restarts Finder to hide removable media from desktop. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/desktop/showremovablemediaondesktop.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.finder "ShowRemovableMediaOnDesktop" -bool "false" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disable File Extension Change Warning in macOS Finder DESCRIPTION: Command to disable the warning dialog when changing file extensions. Requires a Finder restart to take effect. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/finder/fxenableextensionchangewarning.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.finder "FXEnableExtensionChangeWarning" -bool "false" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disable Recent Apps in macOS Dock DESCRIPTION: Command to disable the display of recent applications in the Dock. Requires a Dock restart to take effect. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/dock/show-recents.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.dock "show-recents" -bool "false" && killall Dock ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reading Current Search Scope Setting in macOS Finder DESCRIPTION: Retrieves the current value of the default search scope setting from Finder preferences. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/finder/fxdefaultsearchscope.md#2025-04-20_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults read com.apple.finder "FXDefaultSearchScope" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Minimize Animation to Scale in macOS DESCRIPTION: This Bash script changes the minimize animation effect of the macOS Dock to 'scale'. It updates the configuration using the 'defaults' command and restarts the Dock for the new effect to be visible. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/dock/mineffect.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.dock "mineffect" -string "scale" && killall Dock ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Three-Finger Drag on Trackpad DESCRIPTION: Command to enable three-finger drag functionality for macOS trackpad. Sets the TrackpadThreeFingerDrag setting to true, which allows dragging items using three fingers. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/trackpad/trackpadthreefingerdrag.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.AppleMultitouchTrackpad "TrackpadThreeFingerDrag" -bool "true" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Window Preservation in macOS DESCRIPTION: Set the global default to keep windows and documents when quitting an application. This allows automatic restoration of open windows and documents when the application is reopened. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/misc/nsquitalwayskeepwindows.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write NSGlobalDomain "NSQuitAlwaysKeepsWindow" -bool "true" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reset Dock Position to Default using defaults DESCRIPTION: This command resets the Dock position to its default (bottom of the screen). It uses the `defaults delete` command to remove the `orientation` key from the `com.apple.dock` domain, effectively reverting to the default setting, and then restarts the Dock process using `killall Dock`. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/dock/orientation.md#2025-04-20_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` "defaults delete com.apple.dock \"orientation\" && killall Dock" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting List View as Default Finder Style in macOS DESCRIPTION: Sets the default Finder view style to list view for folders without custom settings. Uses the 'defaults write' command with 'Nlsv' parameter and restarts Finder. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/finder/fxpreferredviewstyle.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.finder "FXPreferredViewStyle" -string "Nlsv" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reading Current Space Switch Value DESCRIPTION: This command retrieves the current setting for the space switching behavior when activating applications, allowing users to verify the existing configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/mission-control/applespacesswitchonactivate.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults read NSGlobalDomain "AppleSpacesSwitchOnActivate" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Digital Clock Format with macOS Defaults Command DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets the digital clock format for the macOS Menu Bar to show the day of the week, day of the month, hour, minute, and second in a specific format using a 24-hour clock. It uses the `defaults write` command to apply the setting. Dependencies include having access to the terminal on a macOS system. The command writes to `com.apple.menuextra.clock` to apply custom date and time formatting, requiring the specified format string as input. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/menubar/dateformat.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.menuextra.clock "DateFormat" -string "\"EEE d MMM HH:mm:ss\"" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Date Inclusion for Screenshots in macOS | Bash DESCRIPTION: This command enables the inclusion of the date and time in screenshot filenames by setting a boolean parameter to true. It utilizes the macOS 'defaults' command to modify the screenshot capture settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/screenshots/include-date.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.screencapture "include-date" -bool "true" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Finder Sidebar Icon Size on macOS (Large) DESCRIPTION: This command sets the Finder sidebar icon size to large on macOS by writing an integer value of 3 to the NSTableViewDefaultSizeMode in NSGlobalDomain and then restarting Finder. The command assumes that the user has permissions to modify system defaults. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/finder/nstableviewdefaultsizemode.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write NSGlobalDomain "NSTableViewDefaultSizeMode" -int "3" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Finder Quit Option in macOS DESCRIPTION: Command to add the Quit option to Finder menu and restart Finder process. Note that this may cause unexpected behavior. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/finder/quitmenuitem.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.finder "QuitMenuItem" -bool "true" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Application Window Grouping in macOS Dock DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets the 'expose-group-apps' preference to 'false', disabling window grouping by application. This is the default behavior. It also restarts the Dock for changes to take effect, utilizing the 'defaults' command and 'killall'. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/mission-control/expose-group-apps.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.dock "expose-group-apps" -bool "false" && killall Dock ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Key Held Down Behavior to False in macOS DESCRIPTION: This Bash command sets the ApplePressAndHoldEnabled parameter to false, causing the system to repeat the character while the key is held down instead of showing the accents menu. This requires the same macOS system environment and utilizes the `defaults` command. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/keyboard/applepressandholdenabled.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write NSGlobalDomain "ApplePressAndHoldEnabled" -bool "false" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding RIB Architecture Counterpart Suffixes in Xcode DESCRIPTION: Add 'Router', 'Interactor', and 'Builder' suffixes to Xcode's counterpart menu, supporting Routing, Interactor, Builder (RIB) architectural patterns. Requires Xcode restart to take effect. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/xcode/ideadditionalcounterpartsuffixes.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.dt.Xcode "IDEAdditionalCounterpartSuffixes" -array-add "Router" "Interactor" "Builder" && killall Xcode ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Dock Icon to Network Usage - Activity Monitor DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures the Activity Monitor Dock icon to display network usage. The icon will show two mirrored line graphs, with blue for downstream and red for upstream traffic. It uses `defaults write` to set `IconType` to 2. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/activity-monitor/icontype.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" -int "2" && killall Activity\ Monitor ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Dock Icon to CPU Usage History - Activity Monitor DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures the Activity Monitor Dock icon to display CPU usage history. The icon will graph CPU usage over time, showing one graph per thread (up to 4 threads) or a single bar graph for total CPU usage if more than 4 threads. `IconType` is set to 6. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/activity-monitor/icontype.md#2025-04-20_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" -int "6" && killall Activity\ Monitor ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Screenshot Format to PNG DESCRIPTION: Configure default screenshot capture format to PNG, which is the default system setting for screenshots SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/screenshots/type.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.screencapture "type" -string "png" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Set Simulator Screenshot Location to Alternative Path DESCRIPTION: Changes the screenshot save location to a custom directory within the user's Pictures folder. The specified folder must exist beforehand. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/simulator/screenshotsavelocation.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.iphonesimulator "ScreenShotSaveLocation" -string "~/Pictures/Simulator Screenshots" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Automatic Space Rearrangement in macOS DESCRIPTION: Configures macOS to maintain the manual arrangement of Spaces. After changing the setting, the Dock is restarted to apply the changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/mission-control/mru-spaces.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.dock "mru-spaces" -bool "false" && killall Dock ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Hiding Desktop Icons in macOS DESCRIPTION: Command to hide all icons on the desktop by setting CreateDesktop to false. Requires Finder restart which is handled by the killall command. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/desktop/createdesktop.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.finder "CreateDesktop" -bool "false" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reading Current Dock Autohide Setting in macOS DESCRIPTION: This command reads and displays the current value of the 'autohide' key from the com.apple.dock domain, showing whether Dock autohide is enabled or disabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/dock/autohide.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults read com.apple.dock "autohide" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Date Inclusion for Screenshots in macOS | Bash DESCRIPTION: This command disables the inclusion of the date in screenshot filenames by setting the associated boolean parameter to false. It allows for simpler filename formats without the date component. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/screenshots/include-date.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.screencapture "include-date" -bool "false" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resetting Finder Sort Setting | Bash DESCRIPTION: Resets the Finder sorting setting, restoring to the default value which is 'false'. Requires execution in macOS terminal. Input is straightforward and affects Finder organization immediately by removing the custom sorting preference. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/finder/_fxsortfoldersfirst.md#2025-04-20_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults delete com.apple.finder "_FXSortFoldersFirst" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Showing Desktop Icons in macOS DESCRIPTION: Command to show all icons on the desktop by setting CreateDesktop to true (default value). Requires Finder restart which is handled by the killall command. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/desktop/createdesktop.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.finder "CreateDesktop" -bool "true" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Screenshot Location to Pictures in macOS Bash DESCRIPTION: This command sets the default screenshot location to the Pictures folder. It updates the `location` property of the `com.apple.screencapture` domain and restarts the SystemUIServer to apply the new setting. Parameter type is a string that represents the new path. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/screenshots/location.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.screencapture "location" -string "~/Pictures" && killall SystemUIServer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting External Disk Visibility to False on macOS DESCRIPTION: This snippet hides external disks from appearing on the macOS desktop. It modifies the 'ShowExternalHardDrivesOnDesktop' parameter by setting it to 'false'. The command requires no additional dependencies beyond macOS's defaults command. The Finder is restarted to apply changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/desktop/showexternalharddrivesondesktop.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.finder "ShowExternalHardDrivesOnDesktop" -bool "false" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enable Spring Loading for Dock Items DESCRIPTION: This command enables spring loading for all Dock items. It uses the `defaults write` command to set the `enable-spring-load-actions-on-all-items` key in the `com.apple.dock` domain to `true`, and then restarts the Dock to apply the changes. The `killall Dock` command is used to restart the Dock. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/misc/enable-spring-load-actions-on-all-items.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.dock "enable-spring-load-actions-on-all-items" -bool "true" && killall Dock ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resetting Trackpad Dragging to Default using defaults DESCRIPTION: This snippet deletes the 'Dragging' preference, effectively resetting it to its default value. The default value is 'false'. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/trackpad/dragging.md#2025-04-20_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults delete com.apple.AppleMultitouchTrackpad "Dragging" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Finder Sidebar Icon Size on macOS (Small) DESCRIPTION: This command sets the Finder sidebar icon size to small on macOS by writing an integer value of 1 to the NSTableViewDefaultSizeMode in NSGlobalDomain and then restarting Finder. No additional software is required to execute this command. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/finder/nstableviewdefaultsizemode.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write NSGlobalDomain "NSTableViewDefaultSizeMode" -int "1" && killall Finder ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting SmartQuotes to False in macOS TextEdit using Bash DESCRIPTION: Sets the 'SmartQuotes' setting to 'false', keeping quotes as typed. Requires macOS and a restart of TextEdit to take effect. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/textedit/smartquotes.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.TextEdit \"SmartQuotes\" -bool \"false\" \&\& killall TextEdit ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Rich Text in macOS TextEdit DESCRIPTION: This command disables rich text format in TextEdit by setting `RichText` to `false`. It uses the `defaults` command to modify the preferences for `com.apple.TextEdit`, followed by `killall TextEdit` to apply the changes. Tested on macOS Ventura, Monterey, and Big Sur. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/textedit/richtext.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.TextEdit \"RichText\" -bool \"false\" \&\& killall TextEdit ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Dock Autohide in macOS DESCRIPTION: This command sets the Dock to always be visible by disabling the autohide feature. It writes a false value to the 'autohide' key in the com.apple.dock domain and restarts the Dock process. SOURCE: https://github.com/yannbertrand/macos-defaults/blob/main/docs/dock/autohide.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` defaults write com.apple.dock "autohide" -bool "false" && killall Dock ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Scroll to Expos√© in macOS Dock Bash DESCRIPTION: Sets the 'scroll-to-open' feature to true, enabling the functionality. This requires execution in the terminal with no additional dependencies. The command restarts the Dock to apply changes, so all applications must be saved prior to execution.
